   20: -module(zip_SUITE).
   21: 
   22: -export([all/0, suite/0,groups/0,init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1, 
   23: 	 init_per_group/2,end_per_group/2, borderline/1, atomic/1,
   24:          bad_zip/1, unzip_from_binary/1, unzip_to_binary/1,
   25:          zip_to_binary/1,
   26:          unzip_options/1, zip_options/1, list_dir_options/1, aliases/1,
   27:          openzip_api/1, zip_api/1, open_leak/1, unzip_jar/1,
   28: 	 unzip_traversal_exploit/1,
   29:          compress_control/1,
   30: 	 foldl/1,fd_leak/1,unicode/1,test_zip_dir/1]).
   31: 
   32: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   33: -include_lib("kernel/include/file.hrl").
   34: -include_lib("stdlib/include/zip.hrl").
   35: 
   36: suite() -> [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]}].
   37: 
   38: all() -> 
   39:     [borderline, atomic, bad_zip, unzip_from_binary,
   40:      unzip_to_binary, zip_to_binary, unzip_options,
   41:      zip_options, list_dir_options, aliases, openzip_api,
   42:      zip_api, open_leak, unzip_jar, compress_control, foldl,
   43:      unzip_traversal_exploit,fd_leak,unicode,test_zip_dir].
   44: 
   45: groups() -> 
   46:     [].
   47: 
   48: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   49:     Config.
   50: 
   51: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   52:     ok.
   53: 
   54: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   55:     Config.
   56: 
   57: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   58:     Config.
   59: 
   60: 
   61: %% Test creating, listing and extracting one file from an archive
   62: %% multiple times with different file sizes. Also check that the
   63: %% modification date of the extracted file has survived.
   64: borderline(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   65:     RootDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
   66:     TempDir = filename:join(RootDir, "borderline"),
   67:     ok = file:make_dir(TempDir),
   68: 
   69:     Record = 512,
   70:     Block = 20 * Record,
   71: 
   72:     lists:foreach(fun(Size) -> borderline_test(Size, TempDir) end,
   73:                   [0, 1, 10, 13, 127, 333, Record-1, Record, Record+1,
   74:                    Block-Record-1, Block-Record, Block-Record+1,
   75:                    Block-1, Block, Block+1,
   76:                    Block+Record-1, Block+Record, Block+Record+1]),
   77: 
   78:     %% Clean up.
   79:     delete_files([TempDir]),
   80:     ok.
   81: 
   82: borderline_test(Size, TempDir) ->
   83:     Archive = filename:join(TempDir, "ar_"++integer_to_list(Size)++".zip"),
   84:     Name = filename:join(TempDir, "file_"++integer_to_list(Size)),
   85:     io:format("Testing size ~p", [Size]),
   86: 
   87:     %% Create a file and archive it.
   88:     {_, _, X0} = erlang:timestamp(),
   89:     file:write_file(Name, random_byte_list(X0, Size)),
   90:     {ok, Archive} = zip:zip(Archive, [Name]),
   91:     ok = file:delete(Name),
   92: 
   93:     %% Verify listing and extracting.
   94:     {ok, [#zip_comment{comment = []},
   95:           #zip_file{name = Name,
   96:                     info = Info,
   97:                     offset = 0,
   98:                     comp_size = _}]} = zip:list_dir(Archive),
   99:     Size = Info#file_info.size,
  100:     {ok, [Name]} = zip:extract(Archive, [verbose]),
  101: 
  102:     %% Verify contents of extracted file.
  103:     {ok, Bin} = file:read_file(Name),
  104:     true = match_byte_list(X0, binary_to_list(Bin)),
  105: 
  106: 
  107:     %% Verify that Unix zip can read it. (if we have a unix zip that is!)
  108:     zipinfo_match(Archive, Name),
  109: 
  110:     ok.
  111: 
  112: zipinfo_match(Archive, Name) ->
  113:     case check_zipinfo_exists() of
  114:         true ->
  115:             Encoding = file:native_name_encoding(),
  116:             Expect = unicode:characters_to_binary(Name ++ "\n",
  117:                                                   Encoding, Encoding),
  118:             cmd_expect("zipinfo -1 " ++ Archive, Expect);
  119:         _ ->
  120:             ok
  121:     end.
  122: 
  123: check_zipinfo_exists() ->
  124:     is_list(os:find_executable("zipinfo")).
  125: 
  126: cmd_expect(Cmd, Expect) ->
  127:     Port = open_port({spawn, make_cmd(Cmd)}, [stream, in, binary, eof]),
  128:     get_data(Port, Expect, <<>>).
  129: 
  130: get_data(Port, Expect, Acc) ->
  131:     receive
  132:         {Port, {data, Bytes}} ->
  133:             get_data(Port, Expect, <<Acc/binary, Bytes/binary>>);
  134:         {Port, eof} ->
  135:             Port ! {self(), close},
  136:             receive
  137:                 {Port, closed} ->
  138:                     true
  139:             end,
  140:             receive
  141:                 {'EXIT',  Port,  _} ->
  142:                     ok
  143:             after 1 ->                          % force context switch
  144:                     ok
  145:             end,
  146:             match_output(Acc, Expect, Port)
  147:     end.
  148: 
  149: match_output(<<C, Output/bits>>, <<C,Expect/bits>>, Port) ->
  150:     match_output(Output, Expect, Port);
  151: match_output(<<_, _/bits>>, <<_, _/bits>>, Port) ->
  152:     kill_port_and_fail(Port, badmatch);
  153: match_output(<<_, _/bits>>=Rest, <<>>, Port) ->
  154:     kill_port_and_fail(Port, {too_much_data, Rest});
  155: match_output(<<>>, <<>>, _Port) ->
  156:     ok.
  157: 
  158: kill_port_and_fail(Port, Reason) ->
  159:     unlink(Port),
  160:     exit(Port, die),
  161:     ct:fail(Reason).
  162: 
  163: make_cmd(Cmd) ->
  164:     Cmd.
  165: %%     case os:type() of
  166: %%      {win32, _} -> lists:concat(["cmd /c",  Cmd]);
  167: %%      {unix, _}  -> lists:concat(["sh -c '",  Cmd,  "'"])
  168: %%     end.
  169: 
  170: %% Verifies a random byte list.
  171: 
  172: match_byte_list(X0, [Byte|Rest]) ->
  173:     X = next_random(X0),
  174:     case (X bsr 26) band 16#ff of
  175:         Byte -> match_byte_list(X, Rest);
  176:         _ -> false
  177:     end;
  178: match_byte_list(_, []) ->
  179:     true.
  180: 
  181: %% Generates a random byte list.
  182: 
  183: random_byte_list(X0, Count) ->
  184:     random_byte_list(X0, Count, []).
  185: 
  186: random_byte_list(X0, Count, Result) when Count > 0->
  187:     X = next_random(X0),
  188:     random_byte_list(X, Count-1, [(X bsr 26) band 16#ff|Result]);
  189: random_byte_list(_X, 0, Result) ->
  190:     lists:reverse(Result).
  191: 
  192: %% This RNG is from line 21 on page 102 in Knuth: The Art of Computer Programming,
  193: %% Volume II, Seminumerical Algorithms.
  194: 
  195: next_random(X) ->
  196:     (X*17059465+1) band 16#fffffffff.
  197: 
  198: %% Test the 'atomic' operations: zip/unzip/list_dir, on archives.
  199: %% Also test the 'cooked' option.
  200: atomic(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  201:     ok = file:set_cwd(proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config)),
  202:     DataFiles = data_files(),
  203:     Names = [Name || {Name,_,_} <- DataFiles],
  204:     io:format("Names: ~p", [Names]),
  205: 
  206:     %% Create a zip  archive.
  207: 
  208:     Zip2 = "zip.zip",
  209:     {ok, Zip2} = zip:zip(Zip2, Names, []),
  210:     Names = names_from_list_dir(zip:list_dir(Zip2)),
  211: 
  212:     %% Same test again, but this time created with 'cooked'
  213: 
  214:     Zip3 = "cooked.zip",
  215:     {ok, Zip3} = zip:zip(Zip3, Names, [cooked]),
  216:     Names = names_from_list_dir(zip:list_dir(Zip3)),
  217:     Names = names_from_list_dir(zip:list_dir(Zip3, [cooked])),
  218: 
  219:     %% Clean up.
  220:     delete_files([Zip2,Zip3|Names]),
  221: 
  222:     ok.
  223: 
  224: %% Test the openzip_open/2, openzip_get/1, openzip_get/2, openzip_close/1
  225: %% and openzip_list_dir/1 functions.
  226: openzip_api(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  227:     ok = file:set_cwd(proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config)),
  228:     DataFiles = data_files(),
  229:     Names = [Name || {Name, _, _} <- DataFiles],
  230:     io:format("Names: ~p", [Names]),
  231: 
  232:     %% Create a zip archive
  233: 
  234:     Zip = "zip.zip",
  235:     {ok, Zip} = zip:zip(Zip, Names, []),
  236: 
  237:     %% Open archive
  238:     {ok, OpenZip} = zip:openzip_open(Zip, [memory]),
  239: 
  240:     %% List dir
  241:     Names = names_from_list_dir(zip:openzip_list_dir(OpenZip)),
  242: 
  243:     %% Get a file
  244:     Name1 = hd(Names),
  245:     {ok, Data1} = file:read_file(Name1),
  246:     {ok, {Name1, Data1}} = zip:openzip_get(Name1, OpenZip),
  247: 
  248:     %% Get all files
  249:     FilesDatas = lists:map(fun(Name) -> {ok, B} = file:read_file(Name),
  250:                                         {Name, B} end, Names),
  251:     {ok, FilesDatas} = zip:openzip_get(OpenZip),
  252: 
  253:     %% Close
  254:     ok = zip:openzip_close(OpenZip),
  255: 
  256:     %% Clean up.
  257:     delete_files([Names]),
  258: 
  259:     ok.
  260: 
  261: %% Test the zip_open/2, zip_get/1, zip_get/2, zip_close/1,
  262: %% and zip_list_dir/1 functions.
  263: zip_api(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  264:     ok = file:set_cwd(proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config)),
  265:     DataFiles = data_files(),
  266:     Names = [Name || {Name, _, _} <- DataFiles],
  267:     io:format("Names: ~p", [Names]),
  268: 
  269:     %% Create a zip archive
  270:     Zip = "zip.zip",
  271:     {ok, Zip} = zip:zip(Zip, Names, []),
  272: 
  273:     %% Open archive
  274:     {ok, ZipSrv} = zip:zip_open(Zip, [memory]),
  275: 
  276:     %% List dir
  277:     Names = names_from_list_dir(zip:zip_list_dir(ZipSrv)),
  278: 
  279:     %% Get a file
  280:     Name1 = hd(Names),
  281:     {ok, Data1} = file:read_file(Name1),
  282:     {ok, {Name1, Data1}} = zip:zip_get(Name1, ZipSrv),
  283: 
  284:     %% Get all files
  285:     FilesDatas = lists:map(fun(Name) -> {ok, B} = file:read_file(Name),
  286:                                         {Name, B} end, Names),
  287:     {ok, FilesDatas} = zip:zip_get(ZipSrv),
  288: 
  289:     %% Close
  290:     ok = zip:zip_close(ZipSrv),
  291: 
  292:     %% Clean up.
  293:     delete_files([Names]),
  294: 
  295:     ok.
  296: 
  297: %% Test that zip doesn't leak processes and ports where the
  298: %% controlling process dies without closing an zip opened with
  299: %% zip:zip_open/1.
  300: open_leak(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  301:     %% Create a zip archive
  302:     Zip = "zip.zip",
  303:     {ok, Zip} = zip:zip(Zip, [], []),
  304: 
  305:     %% Open archive in a another process that dies immediately.
  306:     ZipSrv = spawn_zip(Zip, [memory]),
  307: 
  308:     %% Expect the ZipSrv process to die soon after.
  309:     true = spawned_zip_dead(ZipSrv),
  310: 
  311:     %% Clean up.
  312:     delete_files([Zip]),
  313: 
  314:     ok.
  315: 
  316: spawn_zip(Zip, Options) ->
  317:     Self = self(),
  318:     spawn(fun() -> Self ! zip:zip_open(Zip, Options) end),
  319:     receive
  320:         {ok, ZipSrv} ->
  321:             ZipSrv
  322:     end.
  323: 
  324: spawned_zip_dead(ZipSrv) ->
  325:     Ref = monitor(process, ZipSrv),
  326:     receive
  327:         {'DOWN', Ref, _, ZipSrv, _} ->
  328:             true
  329:     after 1000 ->
  330:             false
  331:     end.
  332: 
  333: %% Test options for unzip, only cwd and file_list currently.
  334: unzip_options(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  335:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  336:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  337:     Long = filename:join(DataDir, "abc.zip"),
  338: 
  339:     %% create a temp directory
  340:     Subdir = filename:join(PrivDir, "t"),
  341:     ok = file:make_dir(Subdir),
  342: 
  343:     FList = ["quotes/rain.txt","wikipedia.txt"],
  344: 
  345:     %% Unzip a zip file in Subdir
  346:     {ok, RetList} = zip:unzip(Long, [{cwd, Subdir},
  347: 				     {file_list, FList}]),
  348: 
  349:     %% Verify.
  350:     true = (length(FList) =:= length(RetList)),
  351:     lists:foreach(fun(F)-> {ok,B} = file:read_file(filename:join(DataDir, F)),
  352: 			   {ok,B} = file:read_file(filename:join(Subdir, F)) end,
  353: 		  FList),
  354:     lists:foreach(fun(F)-> ok = file:delete(F) end,
  355: 		  RetList),
  356: 
  357:     %% Clean up and verify no more files.
  358:     0 = delete_files([Subdir]),
  359:     ok.
  360: 
  361: %% Test that unzip handles directory traversal exploit (OTP-13633)
  362: unzip_traversal_exploit(Config) ->
  363:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  364:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  365:     ZipName = filename:join(DataDir, "exploit.zip"),
  366: 
  367:     %% $ zipinfo -1 test/zip_SUITE_data/exploit.zip 
  368:     %% clash.txt
  369:     %% ../clash.txt
  370:     %% ../above.txt
  371:     %% subdir/../in_root_dir.txt
  372: 
  373:     %% create a temp directory
  374:     SubDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "exploit_test"),
  375:     ok = file:make_dir(SubDir),
  376:     
  377:     ClashFile = filename:join(SubDir,"clash.txt"),
  378:     AboveFile = filename:join(SubDir,"above.txt"),
  379:     RelativePathFile = filename:join(SubDir,"subdir/../in_root_dir.txt"),
  380: 
  381:     %% unzip in SubDir
  382:     {ok, [ClashFile, ClashFile, AboveFile, RelativePathFile]} =
  383: 	zip:unzip(ZipName, [{cwd,SubDir}]),
  384: 
  385:     {ok,<<"This file will overwrite other file.\n">>} =
  386: 	file:read_file(ClashFile),
  387:     {ok,_} = file:read_file(AboveFile),
  388:     {ok,_} = file:read_file(RelativePathFile),
  389: 
  390:     %% clean up
  391:     delete_files([SubDir]),
  392:     
  393:      %% create the temp directory again
  394:     ok = file:make_dir(SubDir),
  395: 
  396:     %% unzip in SubDir
  397:     {ok, [ClashFile, AboveFile, RelativePathFile]} =
  398: 	zip:unzip(ZipName, [{cwd,SubDir},keep_old_files]),
  399: 
  400:     {ok,<<"This is the original file.\n">>} =
  401: 	file:read_file(ClashFile),
  402:    
  403:     %% clean up
  404:     delete_files([SubDir]),
  405:     ok.
  406: 
  407: %% Test unzip a jar file (OTP-7382).
  408: unzip_jar(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  409:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  410:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  411:     JarFile = filename:join(DataDir, "test.jar"),
  412: 
  413:     %% create a temp directory
  414:     Subdir = filename:join(PrivDir, "jartest"),
  415:     ok = file:make_dir(Subdir),
  416:     ok = file:set_cwd(Subdir),
  417: 
  418:     FList = ["META-INF/MANIFEST.MF","test.txt"],
  419: 
  420:     {ok, RetList} = zip:unzip(JarFile),
  421: 
  422:     %% Verify.
  423:     lists:foreach(fun(F)-> {ok,B} = file:read_file(filename:join(DataDir, F)),
  424: 			   {ok,B} = file:read_file(filename:join(Subdir, F)) end,
  425: 		  FList),
  426:     lists:foreach(fun(F)-> ok = file:delete(F) end,
  427: 		  RetList),
  428: 
  429:     %% Clean up and verify no more files.
  430:     0 = delete_files([Subdir]),
  431:     ok.
  432: 
  433: %% Test the options for unzip, only cwd currently.
  434: zip_options(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  435:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  436:     ok = file:set_cwd(PrivDir),
  437:     DataFiles = data_files(),
  438:     Names = [Name || {Name, _, _} <- DataFiles],
  439: 
  440:     %% Make sure cwd is not where we get the files
  441:     ok = file:set_cwd(proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config)),
  442: 
  443:     %% Create a zip archive
  444:     {ok, {_,Zip}} =
  445:         zip:zip("filename_not_used.zip", Names, [memory, {cwd, PrivDir}]),
  446: 
  447:     %% Open archive
  448:     {ok, ZipSrv} = zip:zip_open(Zip, [memory]),
  449: 
  450:     %% List dir
  451:     Names = names_from_list_dir(zip:zip_list_dir(ZipSrv)),
  452: 
  453:     %% Get a file
  454:     Name1 = hd(Names),
  455:     {ok, Data1} = file:read_file(filename:join(PrivDir, Name1)),
  456:     {ok, {Name1, Data1}} = zip:zip_get(Name1, ZipSrv),
  457: 
  458:     %% Get all files
  459:     FilesDatas = lists:map(fun(Name) -> {ok, B} = file:read_file(filename:join(PrivDir, Name)),
  460:                                         {Name, B} end, Names),
  461:     {ok, FilesDatas} = zip:zip_get(ZipSrv),
  462: 
  463:     %% Close
  464:     ok = zip:zip_close(ZipSrv),
  465: 
  466:     %% Clean up.
  467:     delete_files([Names]),
  468: 
  469:     ok.
  470: 
  471: %% Test the options for list_dir... one day.
  472: list_dir_options(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  473:     ok.
  474: 
  475: 
  476: 
  477: 
  478: %% convert zip_info as returned from list_dir to a list of names
  479: names_from_list_dir({ok, Info}) ->
  480:     names_from_list_dir(Info);
  481: names_from_list_dir(Info) ->
  482:     tl(lists:map(fun(#zip_file{name = Name}) -> Name;
  483:                     (_) -> ok end, Info)).
  484: 
  485: %% Returns a sequence of characters.
  486: char_seq(N, First) ->
  487:     char_seq(N, First, []).
  488: 
  489: char_seq(0, _, Result) ->
  490:     Result;
  491: char_seq(N, C, Result) when C < 127 ->
  492:     char_seq(N-1, C+1, [C|Result]);
  493: char_seq(N, _, Result) ->
  494:     char_seq(N, $!, Result).
  495: 
  496: data_files() ->
  497:     Files = [{"first_file", 1555, $a},
  498:              {"small_file", 7, $d},
  499:              {"big_file", 23875, $e},
  500:              {"last_file", 7500, $g}],
  501:     create_files(Files),
  502:     Files.
  503: 
  504: create_files([{Name, dir, _First}|Rest]) ->
  505:     ok = file:make_dir(Name),
  506:     create_files(Rest);
  507: create_files([{Name, Size, First}|Rest]) when is_integer(Size) ->
  508:     ok = file:write_file(Name, char_seq(Size, First)),
  509:     create_files(Rest);
  510: create_files([]) ->
  511:     ok.
  512: 
  513: %% make_dirs([Dir|Rest], []) ->
  514: %%     ok = file:make_dir(Dir),
  515: %%     make_dirs(Rest, Dir);
  516: %% make_dirs([Dir|Rest], Parent) ->
  517: %%     Name = filename:join(Parent, Dir),
  518: %%     ok = file:make_dir(Name),
  519: %%     make_dirs(Rest, Name);
  520: %% make_dirs([], Dir) ->
  521: %%     Dir.
  522: 
  523: %% Try zip:unzip/1 on some corrupted zip files.
  524: bad_zip(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  525:     ok = file:set_cwd(proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config)),
  526:     try_bad("bad_crc",    {bad_crc, "abc.txt"}, Config),
  527:     try_bad("bad_central_directory", bad_central_directory, Config),
  528:     try_bad("bad_file_header",    bad_file_header, Config),
  529:     try_bad("bad_eocd",    bad_eocd, Config),
  530:     try_bad("enoent", enoent, Config),
  531:     GetNotFound = fun(A) ->
  532:                           {ok, O} = zip:openzip_open(A, []),
  533:                           zip:openzip_get("not_here", O)
  534:                   end,
  535:     try_bad("abc", file_not_found, GetNotFound, Config),
  536:     ok.
  537: 
  538: try_bad(N, R, Config) ->
  539:     try_bad(N, R, fun(A) -> io:format("name : ~p\n", [A]),
  540:                             zip:unzip(A, [verbose]) end, Config).
  541: 
  542: try_bad(Name0, Reason, What, Config) ->
  543:     %% Intentionally no macros here.
  544: 
  545:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  546:     Name = Name0 ++ ".zip",
  547:     io:format("~nTrying ~s", [Name]),
  548:     Full = filename:join(DataDir, Name),
  549:     Expected = {error, Reason},
  550:     case What(Full) of
  551:         Expected ->
  552:             io:format("Result: ~p\n", [Expected]);
  553:         Other ->
  554:             io:format("unzip/2 returned ~p (expected ~p)\n", [Other, Expected]),
  555:             ct:fail({bad_return_value, Other})
  556:     end.
  557: 
  558: %% Test extracting to binary with memory option.
  559: unzip_to_binary(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  560:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  561:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  562:     WorkDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "unzip_to_binary"),
  563:     _ = file:make_dir(WorkDir),
  564: 
  565:     ok = file:set_cwd(WorkDir),
  566:     Long = filename:join(DataDir, "abc.zip"),
  567: 
  568:     %% Unzip a zip file into a binary
  569:     {ok, FBList} = zip:unzip(Long, [memory]),
  570: 
  571:     %% Verify.
  572:     lists:foreach(fun({F,B}) -> {ok,B}=file:read_file(filename:join(DataDir, F))
  573:                   end, FBList),
  574: 
  575:     %% Make sure no files created in cwd
  576:     {ok,[]} = file:list_dir(WorkDir),
  577: 
  578:     ok.
  579: 
  580: %% Test compressing to binary with memory option.
  581: zip_to_binary(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  582:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  583:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  584:     WorkDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "zip_to_binary"),
  585:     _ = file:make_dir(WorkDir),
  586: 
  587:     file:set_cwd(WorkDir),
  588:     FileName = "abc.txt",
  589:     ZipName = "t.zip",
  590:     FilePath = filename:join(DataDir, FileName),
  591:     {ok, _Size} = file:copy(FilePath, FileName),
  592: 
  593:     %% Zip to a binary archive
  594:     {ok, {ZipName, ZipB}} = zip:zip(ZipName, [FileName], [memory]),
  595: 
  596:     %% Make sure no files created in cwd
  597:     {ok,[FileName]} = file:list_dir(WorkDir),
  598: 
  599:     %% Zip to a file
  600:     {ok, ZipName} = zip:zip(ZipName, [FileName]),
  601: 
  602:     %% Verify.
  603:     {ok, ZipB} = file:read_file(ZipName),
  604:     {ok, FData} = file:read_file(FileName),
  605:     {ok, [{FileName, FData}]} = zip:unzip(ZipB, [memory]),
  606: 
  607:     %% Clean up.
  608:     delete_files([FileName, ZipName]),
  609: 
  610:     ok.
  611: 
  612: %% Test using the aliases, extract/2, table/2 and create/3.
  613: aliases(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  614:     {_, _, X0} = erlang:timestamp(),
  615:     Size = 100,
  616:     B = list_to_binary(random_byte_list(X0, Size)),
  617:     %% create
  618:     {ok, {"z.zip", ZArchive}} = zip:create("z.zip", [{"b", B}], [memory]),
  619:     %% extract
  620:     {ok, [{"b", B}]} = zip:extract(ZArchive, [memory]),
  621:     %% table
  622:     {ok, [#zip_comment{comment = _}, #zip_file{name = "b",
  623:                                                info = FI,
  624:                                                comp_size = _,
  625:                                                offset = 0}]} =
  626:         zip:table(ZArchive),
  627:     Size = FI#file_info.size,
  628: 
  629:     ok.
  630: 
  631: 
  632: 
  633: %% Test extracting a zip archive from a binary.
  634: unzip_from_binary(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  635:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  636:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  637:     ExtractDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "extract_from_binary"),
  638:     ok = file:make_dir(ExtractDir),
  639:     Archive = filename:join(ExtractDir, "abc.zip"),
  640:     {ok, _Size} = file:copy(filename:join(DataDir, "abc.zip"), Archive),
  641:     FileName = "abc.txt",
  642:     Quote = "quotes/rain.txt",
  643:     Wikipedia = "wikipedia.txt",
  644:     EmptyFile = "emptyFile",
  645:     file:set_cwd(ExtractDir),
  646: 
  647:     %% Read a zip file into a binary and extract from the binary.
  648:     {ok, Bin} = file:read_file(Archive),
  649:     {ok, [FileName,Quote,Wikipedia,EmptyFile]} = zip:unzip(Bin),
  650: 
  651:     %% Verify.
  652:     DestFilename = filename:join(ExtractDir, "abc.txt"),
  653:     {ok, Data} = file:read_file(filename:join(DataDir, FileName)),
  654:     {ok, Data} = file:read_file(DestFilename),
  655: 
  656:     DestQuote = filename:join([ExtractDir, "quotes", "rain.txt"]),
  657:     {ok, QuoteData} = file:read_file(filename:join(DataDir, Quote)),
  658:     {ok, QuoteData} = file:read_file(DestQuote),
  659: 
  660:     %% Clean up.
  661:     delete_files([DestFilename, DestQuote, Archive, ExtractDir]),
  662:     ok.
  663: 
  664: %% oac_files() ->
  665: %%     Files = [{"oac_file", 1459, $x},
  666: %%           {"oac_small", 99, $w},
  667: %%           {"oac_big", 33896, $A}],
  668: %%     create_files(Files),
  669: %%     Files.
  670: 
  671: %% Delete the given list of files and directories.
  672: %% Return total number of deleted files (not directories)
  673: delete_files(List) ->
  674:     do_delete_files(List, 0).
  675: do_delete_files([],Cnt) ->
  676:     Cnt;
  677: do_delete_files([Item|Rest], Cnt) ->
  678:     case file:delete(Item) of
  679:         ok ->
  680:             DelCnt = 1;
  681:         {error,eperm} ->
  682:             file:change_mode(Item, 8#777),
  683:             DelCnt = delete_files(filelib:wildcard(filename:join(Item, "*"))),
  684:             file:del_dir(Item);
  685:         {error,eacces} ->
  686:             %% We'll see about that!
  687:             file:change_mode(Item, 8#777),
  688:             case file:delete(Item) of
  689:                 ok ->
  690: 		    DelCnt = 1;
  691:                 {error,_} ->
  692:                     erlang:yield(),
  693:                     file:change_mode(Item, 8#777),
  694:                     file:delete(Item),
  695:                     DelCnt = 1
  696:             end;
  697:         {error,_} ->
  698:             DelCnt = 0
  699:     end,
  700:     do_delete_files(Rest, Cnt + DelCnt).
  701: 
  702: %% Test control of which files that should be compressed.
  703: compress_control(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  704:     ok = file:set_cwd(proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config)),
  705:     Dir = "compress_control",
  706:     Files = [
  707:              {Dir,                                                          dir,   $d},
  708:              {filename:join([Dir, "first_file.txt"]), 10000, $f},
  709:              {filename:join([Dir, "a_dir"]), dir,   $d},
  710:              {filename:join([Dir, "a_dir", "zzz.zip"]), 10000, $z},
  711:              {filename:join([Dir, "a_dir", "lll.lzh"]), 10000, $l},
  712:              {filename:join([Dir, "a_dir", "eee.exe"]), 10000, $e},
  713:              {filename:join([Dir, "a_dir", "ggg.arj"]), 10000, $g},
  714:              {filename:join([Dir, "a_dir", "b_dir"]), dir,   $d},
  715:              {filename:join([Dir, "a_dir", "b_dir", "ggg.arj"]), 10000, $a},
  716:              {filename:join([Dir, "last_file.txt"]), 10000, $l}
  717:             ],
  718: 
  719:     test_compress_control(Dir,
  720: 			  Files,
  721: 			  [{compress, []}],
  722: 			  []),
  723: 
  724:     test_compress_control(Dir,
  725: 			  Files,
  726: 			  [{uncompress, all}],
  727: 			  []),
  728: 
  729:     test_compress_control(Dir,
  730: 			  Files,
  731: 			  [{uncompress, []}],
  732: 			  [".txt", ".exe", ".zip", ".lzh", ".arj"]),
  733: 
  734:     test_compress_control(Dir,
  735: 			  Files,
  736: 			  [],
  737: 			  [".txt", ".exe"]),
  738: 
  739:     test_compress_control(Dir,
  740: 			  Files,
  741: 			  [{uncompress, {add, [".exe"]}},
  742: 			   {uncompress, {del, [".zip", "arj"]}}],
  743: 			  [".txt", ".zip", "arj"]),
  744: 
  745:     test_compress_control(Dir,
  746: 			  Files,
  747: 			  [{uncompress, []},
  748: 			   {uncompress, {add, [".exe"]}},
  749: 			   {uncompress, {del, [".zip", "arj"]}}],
  750: 			  [".txt", ".zip", ".lzh", ".arj"]),
  751: 
  752:     ok.
  753: 
  754: test_compress_control(Dir, Files, ZipOptions, Expected) ->
  755:     %% Cleanup
  756:     Zip = "zip.zip",
  757:     Names = [N || {N, _, _} <- Files],
  758:     delete_files([Zip]),
  759:     delete_files(lists:reverse(Names)),
  760: 
  761:     create_files(Files),
  762:     {ok, Zip} = zip:create(Zip, [Dir], ZipOptions),
  763: 
  764:     {ok, OpenZip} = zip:openzip_open(Zip, [memory]),
  765:     {ok,[#zip_comment{comment = ""} | ZipList]} = zip:openzip_list_dir(OpenZip),
  766:     io:format("compress_control:  -> ~p  -> ~p\n  -> ~pn", [Expected, ZipOptions, ZipList]),
  767:     verify_compression(Files, ZipList, OpenZip, ZipOptions, Expected),
  768:     ok = zip:openzip_close(OpenZip),
  769: 
  770:     %% Cleanup
  771:     delete_files([Zip]),
  772:     delete_files(lists:reverse(Names)), % Remove plain files before directories
  773: 
  774:     ok.
  775: 
  776: verify_compression([{Name, Kind, _Filler} | Files], ZipList, OpenZip, ZipOptions, Expected) ->
  777:     {Name2, BinSz} =
  778:         case Kind of
  779:             dir ->
  780:                 {Name ++ "/", 0};
  781:             _   ->
  782:                 {ok, {Name, Bin}} = zip:openzip_get(Name, OpenZip),
  783:                 {Name, size(Bin)}
  784:         end,
  785:     {Name2, {value, ZipFile}} = {Name2, lists:keysearch(Name2,  #zip_file.name, ZipList)},
  786:     #zip_file{info = #file_info{size = InfoSz, type = InfoType}, comp_size = InfoCompSz} = ZipFile,
  787: 
  788:     Ext = filename:extension(Name),
  789:     IsComp = is_compressed(Ext, Kind, ZipOptions),
  790:     ExpComp = lists:member(Ext, Expected),
  791:     case {Name, Kind, InfoType, IsComp, ExpComp, BinSz, InfoSz, InfoCompSz} of
  792:         {_, dir, directory, false, _,     Sz, Sz, Sz}      when Sz =:= BinSz -> ok;
  793:         {_, Sz,  regular,   false, false, Sz, Sz, Sz}      when Sz =:= BinSz -> ok;
  794:         {_, Sz,  regular,   true,  true,  Sz, Sz, OtherSz} when Sz =:= BinSz, OtherSz =/= BinSz -> ok
  795:     end,
  796:     verify_compression(Files, ZipList -- [ZipFile], OpenZip, ZipOptions, Expected);
  797: verify_compression([], [], _OpenZip, _ZipOptions, _Expected) ->
  798:     ok.
  799: 
  800: is_compressed(_Ext, dir, _Options) ->
  801:     false;
  802: is_compressed(Ext, _Sz, Options) ->
  803:     CompressOpt =
  804:         case [What || {compress, What} <- Options] of
  805:             [] -> all;
  806:             CompressOpts-> extensions(CompressOpts, all)
  807:         end,
  808:     DoCompress = (CompressOpt =:= all) orelse lists:member(Ext, CompressOpt),
  809:     Default = [".Z", ".zip", ".zoo", ".arc", ".lzh", ".arj"],
  810:     UncompressOpt =
  811:         case [What || {uncompress, What} <- Options] of
  812:             [] -> Default;
  813:             UncompressOpts-> extensions(UncompressOpts, Default)
  814:         end,
  815:     DoUncompress = (UncompressOpt =:= all) orelse lists:member(Ext, UncompressOpt),
  816:     DoCompress andalso not DoUncompress.
  817: 
  818: extensions([H | T], Old) ->
  819:     case H of
  820:         all ->
  821:             extensions(T, H);
  822:         H when is_list(H) ->
  823:             extensions(T, H);
  824:         {add, New} when is_list(New), is_list(Old) ->
  825:             extensions(T, Old ++ New);
  826:         {del, New} when is_list(New), is_list(Old) ->
  827:             extensions(T, Old -- New);
  828:         _ ->
  829:             extensions(T, Old)
  830:     end;
  831: extensions([], Old) ->
  832:     Old.
  833: 
  834: foldl(Config) ->
  835:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  836:     File = filename:join([PrivDir, "foldl.zip"]),
  837: 
  838:     FooBin = <<"FOO">>,
  839:     BarBin = <<"BAR">>,
  840:     Files = [{"foo", FooBin}, {"bar", BarBin}],
  841:     {ok, {File, Bin}} = zip:create(File, Files, [memory]),
  842:     ZipFun = fun(N, I, B, Acc) -> [{N, B(), I()} | Acc] end,
  843:     {ok, FileSpec} = zip:foldl(ZipFun, [], {File, Bin}),
  844:     [{"bar", BarBin, #file_info{}}, {"foo", FooBin, #file_info{}}] = FileSpec,
  845:     {ok, {File, Bin}} = zip:create(File, lists:reverse(FileSpec), [memory]),
  846:     {foo_bin, FooBin} =
  847: 	try
  848: 	    zip:foldl(fun("foo", _, B, _) -> throw(B()); (_, _, _, Acc) -> Acc end, [], {File, Bin})
  849: 	catch
  850: 	    throw:FooBin ->
  851: 		{foo_bin, FooBin}
  852: 	end,
  853:     ok = file:write_file(File, Bin),
  854:     {ok, FileSpec} = zip:foldl(ZipFun, [], File),
  855: 
  856:     {error, einval} = zip:foldl(fun() -> ok end, [], File),
  857:     {error, einval} = zip:foldl(ZipFun, [], 42),
  858:     {error, einval} = zip:foldl(ZipFun, [], {File, 42}),
  859: 
  860:     ok = file:delete(File),
  861:     {error, enoent} = zip:foldl(ZipFun, [], File),
  862: 
  863:     ok.
  864: 
  865: fd_leak(Config) ->
  866:     ok = file:set_cwd(proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config)),
  867:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  868:     Name = filename:join(DataDir, "bad_file_header.zip"),
  869:     BadExtract = fun() ->
  870:                          {error,bad_file_header} = zip:extract(Name),
  871:                          ok
  872:                  end,
  873:     do_fd_leak(BadExtract, 1),
  874: 
  875:     BadCreate = fun() ->
  876:                         {error,enoent} = zip:zip("failed.zip",
  877:                                                  ["none"]),
  878:                         ok
  879:                 end,
  880:     do_fd_leak(BadCreate, 1),
  881: 
  882:     ok.
  883: 
  884: do_fd_leak(_Bad, 10000) ->
  885:     ok;
  886: do_fd_leak(Bad, N) ->
  887:     try Bad() of
  888:         ok ->
  889:             do_fd_leak(Bad, N + 1)
  890:     catch
  891:         C:R:Stk ->
  892:             io:format("Bad error after ~p attempts\n", [N]),
  893:             erlang:raise(C, R, Stk)
  894:     end.
  895: 
  896: unicode(Config) ->
  897:     case file:native_name_encoding() of
  898:         latin1 ->
  899:             {comment, "Native name encoding is Latin-1; skipping all tests"};
  900:         utf8 ->
  901:             DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  902:             ok = file:set_cwd(proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config)),
  903:             test_file_comment(DataDir),
  904:             test_archive_comment(DataDir),
  905:             test_bad_comment(DataDir),
  906:             test_latin1_archive(DataDir),
  907:             case has_zip() of
  908:                 false ->
  909:                     {comment, "No zip program found; skipping some tests"};
  910:                 true ->
  911:                     case zip_is_unicode_aware() of
  912:                         true ->
  913:                             test_filename_compatibility(),
  914:                             ok;
  915:                         false ->
  916:                             {comment, "Old zip program; skipping some tests"}
  917:                     end
  918:             end
  919:     end.
  920: 
  921: test_filename_compatibility() ->
  922:     FancyName = "d",
  923:     Archive = "test.zip",
  924: 
  925:     {ok, Archive} = zip:zip(Archive, [{FancyName, <<"test">>}]),
  926:     zipinfo_match(Archive, FancyName).
  927: 
  928: test_file_comment(DataDir) ->
  929:     Archive = filename:join(DataDir, "zip_file_comment.zip"),
  930:     Comments = ["a", [246], [1024]],
  931:     FileNames = [[C] ++ ".txt" || C <- [$a, 246, 1024]],
  932:     [begin
  933:          test_zip_file(FileName, Comment, Archive),
  934:          test_file_comment(FileName, Comment, Archive)
  935:      end ||
  936:         Comment <- Comments, FileName <- FileNames],
  937:     ok.
  938: 
  939: test_zip_file(FileName, Comment, Archive) ->
  940:     _ = file:delete(Archive),
  941:     io:format("*** zip:zip(). Testing FileName ~ts, Comment ~ts\n",
  942:               [FileName, Comment]),
  943:     ok = file:write_file(FileName, ["anything"]),
  944:     {ok, Archive} =
  945:         zip:zip(Archive, [FileName], [verbose, {comment, Comment}]),
  946:     zip_check(Archive, Comment, FileName, "").
  947: 
  948: test_file_comment(FileName, Comment, Archive) ->
  949:     case test_zip1() of
  950:         false ->
  951:             ok;
  952:         true ->
  953:             _ = file:delete(Archive),
  954:             io:format("*** zip(1). Testing FileName ~ts, Comment ~ts\n",
  955:                       [FileName, Comment]),
  956:             ok = file:write_file(FileName, ["anything"]),
  957:             R = os:cmd("echo " ++ Comment ++ "| zip -c " ++
  958:                            Archive ++ " " ++ FileName),
  959:             io:format("os:cmd/1 returns ~lp\n", [R]),
  960:             zip_check(Archive, "", FileName, Comment)
  961:     end.
  962: 
  963: test_archive_comment(DataDir) ->
  964:     Archive = filename:join(DataDir, "zip_archive_comment.zip"),
  965:     Chars = [$a, 246, 1024],
  966:     [test_archive_comment(Char, Archive) || Char <- Chars],
  967:     ok.
  968: 
  969: test_archive_comment(Char, Archive) ->
  970:     case test_zip1() of
  971:         false ->
  972:             ok;
  973:         true ->
  974:             _ = file:delete(Archive),
  975:             FileName = "a.txt",
  976:             Comment = [Char],
  977:             io:format("*** Testing archive Comment ~ts\n", [Comment]),
  978:             ok = file:write_file(FileName, ["anything"]),
  979: 
  980:             {ok, _} =
  981:                 zip:zip(Archive, [FileName], [verbose, {comment, Comment}]),
  982:             Res = os:cmd("zip -z " ++ Archive),
  983:             io:format("os:cmd/1 returns ~lp\n", [Res]),
  984:             true = lists:member(Char, Res),
  985: 
  986:             os:cmd("echo " ++ Comment ++ "| zip -z "++
  987:                        Archive ++ " " ++ FileName),
  988:             zip_check(Archive, Comment, FileName, "")
  989:     end.
  990: 
  991: test_zip1() ->
  992:     has_zip() andalso zip_is_unicode_aware().
  993: 
  994: has_zip() ->
  995:     os:find_executable("zip") =/= false.
  996: 
  997: zip_is_unicode_aware() ->
  998:     S = os:cmd("zip -v | grep 'UNICODE_SUPPORT'"),
  999:     string:find(S, "UNICODE_SUPPORT") =/= nomatch.
 1000: 
 1001: zip_check(Archive, ArchiveComment, FileName, FileNameComment) ->
 1002:     {ok, CommentAndFiles} = zip:table(Archive),
 1003:     io:format("zip:table/1 returns\n  ~lp\n", [CommentAndFiles]),
 1004:     io:format("checking archive comment ~lp\n", [ArchiveComment]),
 1005:     [_] = [C || #zip_comment{comment = C} <- CommentAndFiles,
 1006:                 C =:= ArchiveComment],
 1007:     io:format("checking filename ~lp\n", [FileName]),
 1008:     io:format("and filename comment ~lp\n", [FileNameComment]),
 1009:     [_] = [F || #zip_file{name = F, comment = C} <- CommentAndFiles,
 1010:                 F =:= FileName, C =:= FileNameComment],
 1011:     {ok, FileList} = zip:unzip(Archive, [verbose]),
 1012:     io:format("zip:unzip/2 returns\n  ~lp\n", [FileList]),
 1013:     true = lists:member(FileName, FileList),
 1014:     ok.
 1015: 
 1016: test_bad_comment(DataDir) ->
 1017:     Archive = filename:join(DataDir, "zip_bad_comment.zip"),
 1018:     FileName = "a.txt",
 1019:     file:write_file(FileName, ["something"]),
 1020:     Comment = [9999999],
 1021:     {error,{bad_unicode,Comment}} =
 1022:         zip:zip(Archive, [FileName], [verbose, {comment, Comment}]).
 1023: 
 1024: test_latin1_archive(DataDir) ->
 1025:     Archive = filename:join(DataDir, "zip-latin1.zip"),
 1026:     FileName = [246] ++ ".txt",
 1027:     ArchiveComment = [246],
 1028:     zip_check(Archive, ArchiveComment, FileName, "").
 1029: 
 1030: test_zip_dir(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1031:     case {os:find_executable("unzip"), os:type()} of
 1032:         {UnzipPath, {unix,_}} when is_list(UnzipPath)->
 1033:             DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1034:             Dir = filename:join([DataDir, "test-zip", "dir-1"]),
 1035:             TestZipOutputDir = filename:join(DataDir, "test-zip-output"),
 1036:             TestZipOutput = filename:join(TestZipOutputDir, "test.zip"),
 1037:             zip:create(TestZipOutput, [Dir]),
 1038:             run_command(UnzipPath, ["-o", TestZipOutput,  "-d", TestZipOutputDir]),
 1039:             {ok, FileContent} = file:read_file(filename:join([TestZipOutputDir, Dir, "file.txt"])),
 1040:             <<"OKOK\n">> = FileContent,
 1041:             ok;
 1042:         _ -> {skip, "Not Unix or unzip program not found"}
 1043:     end.
 1044: 
 1045: run_command(Command, Args) ->
 1046:     Port = erlang:open_port({spawn_executable, Command}, [{args, Args}, exit_status]),
 1047:     (fun Reciver() ->
 1048:              receive
 1049:                  {Port,{exit_status,_}} -> ok;
 1050:                  {Port, S} -> io:format("UNZIP: ~p~n", [S]),
 1051:                               Reciver()
 1052:              end
 1053:      end)().
 1054:
